issue.title: Always check `$config_dependencies` visibility at use

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
All dependencies for `select` expressions are collected in an implicit `$config_dependencies` attribute. Even with
`--incompatible_visibility_private_attributes_at_definition`, visibility for this attribute is now checked relative to the use rather than the definition of the rule.

Fixes #19126

issue.title: [6.4.0] `config_setting` incorrectly treated as implicit dependency by `--incompatible_visibility_private_attributes_at_definition`

milestone.title: 6.4.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that need to be resolved before the 6.4.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.title: [6.4.0] Always check `$config_dependencies` visibility at use

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
All dependencies for `select` expressions are collected in an implicit `$config_dependencies` attribute. Even with `--incompatible_visibility_private_attributes_at_definition`, visibility for this attribute is now checked relative to the use rather than the definition of the rule.

Fixes #19126

Closes #19139.

Commit https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/5ca89d43ce965ae0884f53161b3bfa74966c7923

PiperOrigin-RevId: 553830083
Change-Id: Ic4af0f5ad9a0c627c973cd5ce88dd1e1bf51474e

body: A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 6.4.0 RC1](https://releases.bazel.build/6.4.0/rc1/index.html). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible. Thanks!
I gave 6.4.0rc1 a quick test and confirmed that it does fix the issue in my actual repository, so everything looks good here!
